title: As more champions come out, more specialized rune pages are required and thus..
body:
Thus it's about time Riot raised the number of total runepages from 20 to 30. (hey, something to spend my ip on finally).
Now who's with me?

replies.body: either that, or alow us to eddit them in champ select, maybe with a new modular toolkit where you don't save entire run pages but your reds, yellows, blues and quints separately and then put them together in champ select, as often i just would want to exchange a few runes and not an entire page, like switching yellows to flat armor when i face Riven.
The only reason they won't do that is because nobody will buy more than 1 rune page because they can be changed.

Then there is me who is holding steady at 2 rune pages.

# #ForeverBroke

Imo we shouldn't be limited with how many mastery pages and rune pages we can have.

If I could I would definitely build specialized rune pages and mastery pages for each champion to benefit specifically that champion.

Agreed, while i don't care too much about the rune pages, since i have most of my bases covered for the champs i mainly play and i have some general ones that work with a wide variety.  I definitely want more Mastery pages, since while some pages might be similar to another, i usually have at least one difference for specific champions over others.
I agree, I would buy 10 more!
I like your icon
This also would be a decent business decision as people may buy them with RP
you are an absolute lazy monkey if you need more than 10 rune pages honestly

Not really. I have specific rune pages set up for specific champs to fit a certain playstyle that I use just for them.

10 pages isn't enough for generic roles either.

OR ORRRRRRRRRR
they could just make it so we can adjust runes during champ select...
don't even need allot of rune pages, several years back someone reached diamond with only 3 runepages
People hit Diamond while only using 2 rune pages all of the time.

eh I think they should just be discontinued. If riot wants more custom champion variety then they will have to put more work into custom champion ability changes. Think HOTS but with specialized champ customization with clear trade offs. It would also make Riot's balancing job much easier. Yes, you can make Leona herself proc her passive, but her allies can no longer do the same (just an example). This is really the kind of customization people would like but can rarely get except maybe on Kha, but its not really true customization since your just deciding which upgrade is the least powerful.

I actually love this idea. I thought about it too.

Would love to have 2-3 free rune pages for all current players while they're at it. I'm at the point where I know I need to buy some more runes, but I don't have the rune page count to support them anyway. Have 7 Rune Pages at the moment. Going to buy some 6300 champs instead, those guys are pretty much OP.

This is another reason Riot needs to slow down on releasing new champs. I mean it's the 3rd month of year and we are now on our **2nd** new champ. at this rate, in a few years we will be up to 200 champs, see 15 of them tops, 125 of them will need QOL updates and have rune pages to cover maybe half the roster if you make them as plain and simple as possible.
they aren't even releasing champions fast at all compared to their old way of releasing champs which was new champ every 2/3 weeks

2 champs with in the first 3 months of a year is still a lot. if they keep stay at this pace, we are looking at 7-8 champs (7 if they let the {{champion:44}} rework have it's time in the spotlight) this year to add on to the 150 (give or take) we have now. they may have cut back, but the has roster is already so huge that they need to cut back more. 
We already have a long list of champs that need reworks and that list is just getting longer each year cause they keep cranking out more champs than they update.

I also want something to spend all my ip on but more runepages just isn't needed.  I mean jhin can just use standard ad runes, sol can use pretty basic ap runes.  You really only need about 4-5 rune pages to cover each role and then maybe 5 extra for champs like jax, akali etc.

Honestly I was hoping the hextech crafting would have some sort of ip sink but alas.
I sometimes need several rune pages for a single champion.

While I suppose there's no real reason not to- at the same time- you've got to be kidding me. What do you do? Change like 3 runes and call it a new page? There's not **that** much variety available in runes.
Personally, I disagree.
No, not really.
I cant even afford rune pages on top of runes

Or pair marks with quints. And seals and glyphs. Then you can pick two sets. Like two pages in an open book. Most yellows and blues are used reactively and reds and quints are used based on your pick.
how about making them not incredibly fucking expensive? it's like 500,000 IP to buy 9 of every rune, 3 of every quint
